sen.j: 池田荘（いけだのしょう）は、平安時代～室町時代にかけて美濃国にあった荘園。
sen.e: Ikeda-no-sho Estate was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) in Mino Province during the Heian and Muromachi Periods.
Ikeda-no-sho Manor was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) in Mino Province during the Heian and Muromachi Periods.
Ikeda-no-sho Manor was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) in Mino Province during the Heian and Muromachi Periods.
It was an estate of Imakumanosha Shrine
It was an estate of Imakumanosha Shrine
It was an estate of Imakumanosha Shrine
It was located in present Ibi-gun, Gifu Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように書換え

sen.e: Today's Ikeda-cho (Gifu Prefecture) was its center.
Ikeda-cho (Gifu Prefecture) was at its center.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように書換え
sen.e: Ikeda-cho (Gifu Prefecture) was at its center.

sen.j: 平安時代に池田郡司職を継承していた紀氏が開発し、新熊野社に寄進。
sen.e: The Ki clan, which had successively handed down the post of gunji (country manager) in Ikeda District during the Heian Period, developed the manor and donated it to Imakumanosha Shrine.
The Ki clan, which had successively handed down the post of gunji (district manager) in Ikeda District during the Heian Period, developed the manor and donated it to Imakumanosha Shrine.
The Ki clan, which had successively handed down the post of gunji (district manager) in Ikeda District during the Heian Period, developed the manor and donated it to Imakumanosha Shrine.

sen.cmt: Title caseにしました不必要な「a」を削除

sen.e: Post of betto (chief administrator of the manor)
sen.cmt: 「Post of」を削除Title caseにしました
紀奉光→KI no Tomomitsu *紀はフルネーム表記の姓に当るのでKiではなくKiとしました。

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)に美濃守護家土岐氏が地頭となって勢力を拡大、応仁の乱までに荘園としての機能を喪失した。
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the family of Mino no kuni Shugo (provincial constable of Mino Province), the Toki clan, was appointed to be jito (land steward appointed by the central military government to each of the estates (shoen) into which the countryside was divided), and began expanding its control over the estate, and by the time when the Onin War occurred, the estate had lost its function as a shoen.
sen.cmt: 地頭→jito (land steward appointed by the central military government to each of the estates (shoen) into which the countryside was divided) [http://encyclopedia2.thefreedictionary.com/jito]
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the family of Mino no Kuni Shugo (provincial constable of Mino Province), the Toki clan, became jito (manager and lord of a manor), and began expanding its control over the area which, by the time of the Onin War, had lost its function as a shoen.
sen.cmt: 「was appointed to be」→「became」「estate」→「area」文の後半を再構成
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the family of Mino no Kuni Shugo (provincial constable of Mino Province), the Toki clan, became jito (manager and lord of a manor), and began expanding its control over the area which, by the time of the Onin War, had lost its function as a shoen.
